DOC.brief_summary: Chloride-rich isotonic crystalloid solutions have been shown to exert electrolyte imbalance and metabolic acidosis in critically ill patients. The aim of this investigation is to compare the influence of 0.9% saline and plasmalyte solution on acid-base balance and electrolytes in healthy patients undergoing major spine surgeries.
DOC.brief_title: The Aim of This Investigation is to Compare the Influence of 0.9% Saline and Plasmalyte Solution on Acid-base Balance and Electrolytes in Healthy Patients Undergoing Major Spine Surgeries.
DOC.criteria: 1.50 patients (aged 2065) undergoing cervical or lumbar spine surgery who were diagnosed spinal stenosis involving more than tow spinal levels. 1. ASA class III or IV 2. pregnancy 3. breast feeding 4. lack of mental weakness(including disabled) 5. using diuretics 6. respiratory insufficiency 7. metabolic acidosis or alkalosis 8. coagulation disorder 9. over hydtration 10. renal failure or serum creatinine > 1.4mg/dl 11. anemia (Hemoglobin 9.0<mg/dl) 12. hypernatremia (Na > 145mEq/L) 13. Hyperkalemia (K>5.5mEq/L) 14. psychological medication or any drugs that influences renal clearance
DOC.keyword: metabolic acidosis, plasmalyte solution, 0.9% normal saline
